trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app | Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app | Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to your Windows app.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to send push notifications to a Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app by using Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to send push notifications to a Windows Runtime 8.1 universal app by using Azure App Service Mobile Apps and Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: In this scenario, when a new item is added, your Mobile App backend sends a push notification to all Windows apps registered with the Windows Notification Service (WNS).
trans-unit.target: In this scenario, when a new item is added, your Mobile App backend sends a push notification to all Windows apps registered with the Windows Notification Service (WNS).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the App Service Mobile App quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the App Service Mobile App quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the quickstart tutorial <link><linkText>Create a Windows app</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete the quickstart tutorial <link><linkText>Create a Windows app</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the push notification extension package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see <link><linkText>Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see <link><linkText>Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An active <link><linkText>Microsoft Store account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: An active <link><linkText>Microsoft Store account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Visual Studio Community 2013</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Visual Studio Community 2013</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Complete the <link><linkText>quickstart tutorial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Complete the <link><linkText>quickstart tutorial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Create a Notification Hub
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Create a Notification Hub

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a new Notification Hub to handle push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a new Notification Hub to handle push notifications.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a hub in the same resource group, you do not need to complete this section.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a hub in the same resource group, you do not need to complete this section.

trans-unit.source: Visit the [Azure Portal].
trans-unit.target: Visit the [Azure Portal].

trans-unit.source: Click Browse All > Mobile Apps > the backend that you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse All > Mobile Apps > the backend that you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings > Mobile > Push.
trans-unit.target: Click Settings > Mobile > Push.

trans-unit.source: Follow the work flow to create a notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Follow the work flow to create a notification hub.

trans-unit.source: You will need to create a new namespace if there is none in your current resource group.
trans-unit.target: You will need to create a new namespace if there is none in your current resource group.

trans-unit.source: Click Create once you've configured all the settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Create once you've configured all the settings.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will use this notificaton hub to enable push for your app.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will use this notificaton hub to enable push for your app.

trans-unit.source: Register your app for push notifications
trans-unit.target: Register your app for push notifications

trans-unit.source: Before you can send push notifications to your Windows apps from Azure, you must submit your app to the Windows Store.
trans-unit.target: Before you can send push notifications to your Windows apps from Azure, you must submit your app to the Windows Store.

trans-unit.source: You can then configure your server project to integrate with WNS.
trans-unit.target: You can then configure your server project to integrate with WNS.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click Store > Associate App with the Store....
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, right-click the Windows Store app project, click Store > Associate App with the Store....

trans-unit.source: In the wizard, click Next, sign in with your Microsoft account, type a name for your app in Reserve a new app name, then click Reserve.
trans-unit.target: In the wizard, click Next, sign in with your Microsoft account, type a name for your app in Reserve a new app name, then click Reserve.

trans-unit.source: After the app registration is successfully created, select the new app name, click Next, and then click Associate.
trans-unit.target: After the app registration is successfully created, select the new app name, click Next, and then click Associate.

trans-unit.source: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: This adds the required Windows Store registration information to the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 1 and 3 for the Windows Phone Store app project using the same registration you previously created for the Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 1 and 3 for the Windows Phone Store app project using the same registration you previously created for the Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Windows Dev Center, sign-in with your Microsoft account, click the new app registration in My apps, then expand Services > Push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Windows Dev Center, sign-in with your Microsoft account, click the new app registration in My apps, then expand Services > Push notifications.

trans-unit.source: In the Push notifications page, click Live Services site under Microsoft Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the Push notifications page, click Live Services site under Microsoft Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: In the App Settings tab, make a note of the values of Client secret and Package SID.
trans-unit.target: In the App Settings tab, make a note of the values of Client secret and Package SID.

trans-unit.source: The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.
trans-unit.target: The client secret and package SID are important security credentials.

trans-unit.source: Do not share these values with anyone or distribute them with your app.
trans-unit.target: Do not share these values with anyone or distribute them with your app.

trans-unit.source: Configure Mobile App to send push requests
trans-unit.target: Configure Mobile App to send push requests

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Portal], select Browse > Mobile App > your app > Push notification services.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Portal], select Browse > Mobile App > your app > Push notification services.

trans-unit.source: In Windows Notification Service, enter the Security key (client secret) and Package SID that you obtained from the Live Services site, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In Windows Notification Service, enter the Security key (client secret) and Package SID that you obtained from the Live Services site, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Your Mobile App backend is now configured to work with WNS.
trans-unit.target: Your Mobile App backend is now configured to work with WNS.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Update the server to send push notifications
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Update the server to send push notifications

trans-unit.source: Now that push notifications are enabled in the app, you must update your app backend to send push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Now that push notifications are enabled in the app, you must update your app backend to send push notifications.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the server project and click Manage NuGet Packages, search for Microsoft.Azure.NotificationHubs, then click Install.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the server project and click Manage NuGet Packages, search for Microsoft.Azure.NotificationHubs, then click Install.

trans-unit.source: This installs the Notification Hubs client library.
trans-unit.target: This installs the Notification Hubs client library.

trans-unit.source: In the server project, open Controllers > TodoItemController.cs, and add the following using statements:
trans-unit.target: In the server project, open Controllers > TodoItemController.cs, and add the following using statements:

trans-unit.source: In the PostTodoItem method, add the following code after the call to InsertAsync:
trans-unit.target: In the PostTodoItem method, add the following code after the call to InsertAsync:

trans-unit.source: This code tells the notification hub to send a push notification after a new item is insertion.
trans-unit.target: This code tells the notification hub to send a push notification after a new item is insertion.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Publish the mobile backend to Azure
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Publish the mobile backend to Azure

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, right-click the solution, then click Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, right-click the solution, then click Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Manage NuGet Packages dialog box.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Manage NuGet Packages dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Search for the App Service Mobile App client SDK for managed and click Install, select all client projects in the solution, and accept the terms of use.
trans-unit.target: Search for the App Service Mobile App client SDK for managed and click Install, select all client projects in the solution, and accept the terms of use.

trans-unit.source: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference in all client projects to the Azure Mobile Push library for Windows.
trans-unit.target: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference in all client projects to the Azure Mobile Push library for Windows.

trans-unit.source: Open the shared App.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statements:
trans-unit.target: Open the shared App.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statements:

trans-unit.source: In the same file, add the following InitNotificationsAsync method definition to the App class:
trans-unit.target: In the same file, add the following InitNotificationsAsync method definition to the App class:

trans-unit.source: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from WNS, and then registers that ChannelURI with your App Service Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: This code retrieves the ChannelURI for the app from WNS, and then registers that ChannelURI with your App Service Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the OnLaunched event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the async modifier to the method definition and add the following call to the new InitNotificationsAsync method, as in the following example:
trans-unit.target: At the top of the OnLaunched event handler in App.xaml.cs, add the async modifier to the method definition and add the following call to the new InitNotificationsAsync method, as in the following example:

trans-unit.source: This guarantees that the short-lived ChannelURI is registered each time the application is launched.
trans-unit.target: This guarantees that the short-lived ChannelURI is registered each time the application is launched.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer double-click Package.appxmanifest of the Windows Store app, in Notifications, set Toast capable to Yes.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer double-click Package.appxmanifest of the Windows Store app, in Notifications, set Toast capable to Yes.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, click Save All.
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, click Save All.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step in the Windows Phone Store app project.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step in the Windows Phone Store app project.

trans-unit.source: Your app is now ready to receive toast notifications.
trans-unit.target: Your app is now ready to receive toast notifications.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Test push notifications in your app
